result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Damon Lamar Douglas

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Damon Lamar Douglas in court.  Attorney Craig S. Powell in court for Damon Lamar Douglas.  Assistant District Attorney Paul Leonard Tiffin in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference. 
Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar. Any pretrial motions to be filed 48 hours in advance of final pretrial.  Any motions must be filed by 11/4,  with response/reply filed by 11/23/22.   Case adjourned in br 45.  mn
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 6, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Damon Lamar Douglas in court.  Attorney Craig S. Powell in court for Damon Lamar Douglas.  Attorney Paul Leonard Tiffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense acknowledges receipt of all discovery but requests additional time for negotiations.  Court addresses Justice Point violation with defendant.  Court scheduled a scheduling conference.  Case adjourned to Branch 45, Rm G55A CJF.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-29-22

Defendant Damon Lamar Douglas in court with attorney Craig S. Powell.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Damon Lamar Douglas appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense is still awaiting additional discovery for review to determine case posture. Case adjourned for a status conference.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Br 45, room 502 SB  Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Damon Lamar Douglas in court with Attorney Craig S. Powell; both appear by video.  Paul Tiffin appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detectives M. Saavedra, C. Lindert and R. Smith. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 34.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Damon Lamar Douglas in court with attorney Craig S. Powell.  Defendant Damon Lamar Douglas in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Damon Lamar Douglas appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Commissioner advised if DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant Court orders the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant. Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 057390,
Payable Number: 1014716,
Receipt Number: 22RP025035,
Amount: $20.00
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
